title: Airframe Systems Engineer
job_desc:
Department

Cabin, Systems & Structure

Employee Type

Probationary

Cebu Pacific’s commitment to ensuring every Juan’s safety at all times will always be a top priority. Our Engineering & Fleet Management team leverage on their technical expertise and strong partnership with various business functions in upholding our commitment to our aircrafts’ airworthiness, safety, and reliability, of our growing fleet, aligning with the highest aviation standards. At Cebu Pacific, we do more than aircraft maintenance—we engineer innovation and design strategies that shape the future of air travel of every Juan

Be a Moment Maker and craft solutions that uphold operational excellence and overall Cebu Pacific flying experience as an Airframe Systems Engineer . Visit our careers site to learn more about how your moment matters at Cebu Pacific: CEB Careers Site

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Studies and analyzes all pertinent correspondences, manuals and publications periodically issued by the Aircraft component manufacturers for possible inclusion in the company’s Aircraft Operations Specifications.
  • Studies, analyzes, and issues instruction on optional, recommended and mandatory inspections and modifications issued by FAA, CAAP, component manufacturers to meet implementation target.
  • Coordinates with the aircraft component manufacturers all observed malfunctions that are not in the approved manual references.
  • Assists in the preparation and establishment of a Maintenance Program for Aircraft Systems.
  • Coordinates, evaluates, recommends, designs and approves aircraft improvements such as modifications and part upgrades for aircraft systems and components.
  • Supervises and manages unit projects and aircrafts, ensuring technical tasks are accomplished accordingly.
  • Coordinates with contracted agency’s Engineering Division concerns regarding maintenance and modifications for aircraft and its components.

Qualifications:

  • Must have a Bachelor's degree in Aeronautical Engineering or other related courses.
  • Preferably has a PRC or an Aeronautical Engineering license
  • Preferably has more than six (6) years of work-related experience in the airline or engineering industry

Why Join Us:

  • We are the first Great Place to Work ® certified airline in Southeast Asia.
  • We have been recognized as Best Employer Brand on LinkedIn for two consecutive years.
  • Be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation and continuous improvement.
  • Play a key role in developing and nurturing the talents that drive our success.
  • Accelerate your career with access to extensive learning programs and leadership development initiatives, all under CEB U, our corporate university.
  • Enjoy unique employee perks such as free travel for you and your family. Expanded coverage to common law partners and same sex partners!
  • Be assured of a comprehensive healthcare coverage upon hire.

Note: This position is for an Individual Contributor and will be based in Pasay City, Metro Manila but currently follows a hybrid workplace flexibility arrangement.

Your moment matters. Be a Moment Maker!

We do not require payment from candidates during the recruitment process nor do we require submission of physical application documents. For official information on our job openings, please visit our LinkedIn or career site at CEB Careers Site for reference.

6 - 8 years

title: Graduate Engineer
job_desc:
Are you ready to kickstart your career adventure?

Aurecon's Graduate Programme offers the perfect opportunity to explore your potential while gaining valuable skills and experiences. We believe every career should be a rewarding adventure.

The Opportunity

Available positions in Civil & Structural, Electrical, and Mechanical Engineering in Aurecon Manila.

Teams focused on Energy, Geospatial, Rails, Bridge, and Roads.

What You'll Experience

You’ll get the opportunity to see what your career could look like, expand your knowledge and be immersed in our supportive and inclusive teams. You'll be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone, build your own network and experiment with different pathways you might pursue after finishing your degree.

  • Real-life projects at the forefront of innovation and sustainability
  • Engaging interactive learning experiences and the opportunity to flex your creative skills during the 'Intern Innovation Challenge’
  • Access to mentors and networking opportunities through Limelight, our early careers professional network
  • Flexible and hybrid work set-up for improved productivity and work-life balance

What We're Looking For

  • Bachelor's Degree holder in Civil or Structural Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related degree
  • Passion for design engineering, carbon neutrality, and sustainability
  • Strong relationship-building skills and a mindset to push boundaries
  • Enthusiasm for learning and owning your career adventure

How To Apply

  • Application - apply with your CV, cover letter and transcript, and identify the teams you are most interested in.
  • Interview - if selected, you'll be invited for an interview with the team

People who work at Aurecon are not like everyone else. We look at the world differently. But we also share a lot in common. A spirit of adventure. A sense of wonder and endless possibility. And hardwired in our DNA is the need to leave a positive legacy.

We are a design, engineering and advisory company with 7,800 experts in 11 locations across Asia Pacific. Our purpose is bringing ideas to life, to imagine and co-create with our clients a better future for people and the planet.

Joining Aurecon means you’ll be at the award-winning edge of innovation and sustainability; in 2025 we ranked #1 in Engineering Consulting sector and #21 in the overall Top 100 employers list.

Feeling Adventurous?

Then please apply. Your background, unique needs and individuality will be valued. Visit our website to learn more at www.aurecongroup.com.

job_desc:

title: Design Engineer
job_desc:
What You’ll Do

The Design Engineer role is responsible for the design, documentation, and verification of customized deployments of our standard products for specialized customer applications. Additionally, the Design Engineer may be required to design, document, and verify new product extensions to existing product platforms that meet market requirements for performance, cost, safety, schedule, aesthetics, and manufacturability. The Design Engineer is also responsible to contribute to engineering sustainment functions related to increasing customer satisfaction, cost containment and continuous improvement initiatives.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
job_desc:
Qualifications for a Mechanical Design Engineer:

  1. Education: A bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or a related field is typically required. Must be license Mechanical Engineer
  2. Experience: At least 2 to 3 years' experience working as Mechanical Engineer in sewage treatment plant construction projects or related water/wastewater projects is highly desirable.
  3. Knowledge of Sewage Treatment Processes: A comprehensive understanding of sewage treatment processes is necessary. Mechanical Design Engineers should be familiar with the various components of sewage treatment plants, such as pumps, motors, blowers, screens, filters, and piping systems.
  4. Design Software Proficiency: Proficiency in using computer-aided design (CAD) software such as AutoCAD.
  5. Mechanical Systems and Equipment: Knowledge of mechanical systems and equipment used in sewage treatment plants is important. This includes pumps, motors, blowers, compressors, valves, mixers, and other mechanical components. Familiarity with industry standards and specifications related to mechanical design and equipment selection is beneficial.


Job Description of a Mechanical Design Engineer:

  1. Mechanical Design Development: Creating detailed mechanical designs, equipment layouts, and technical drawings for sewage treatment plant components and systems. Applying engineering principles to ensure proper functionality, reliability, and efficiency of mechanical systems.
  2. Equipment Selection: Evaluating and selecting appropriate mechanical equipment, such as pumps, motors, blowers, compressors, valves, mixers, and filtration systems, based on project requirements, performance criteria, and industry standards.
  3. Specifications and Standards: Adhering to relevant specifications, standards, and codes in the mechanical design process. Ensuring compliance with environmental regulations and industry best practices in sewage treatment plant construction.
  4. Design Integration: Collaborating with civil engineers, electrical engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate mechanical designs seamlessly within the overall sewage treatment plant construction project. Coordinating with various disciplines to resolve design conflicts and ensure efficient design integration.
  5. Feasibility Studies: Conducting feasibility studies and engineering analysis to evaluate design alternatives, performance requirements, and cost-effectiveness. Providing recommendations on design optimization and value engineering opportunities.

title: Mechanical Project Engineer
job_desc:
Position: Project Engineer - Mechanical Works


Responsibilities:

  1. Preparation of mechanical plans, detailed drawings, Bill of Materials, cost estimates, work schedules, written communications, Work Requests, Request for Procurement, and Job & Performance Evaluation Report needed in the implementation of projects.
  2. Prepare mechanical design works; gather data as basis for design; coordinate the implementation of projects; and regular visitation of project sites to ensure that design specifications are strictly adhered.
  3. Receive and evaluate machinery, equipment, and materials upon delivery at the plant.
  4. Undertake trouble shooting of mechanical problems involving newly installed machinery, equipment and/or process.
  5. Maintain proper filing of plans, drawings, machinery & equipment manuals, brochures, catalogs, office records, and other documents.
  6. Follow-up orders when needed to ensure timely completion of project based on schedule.
  7. Prepare materials for presentation to management; update Cannery Machinery and Equipment layout. Prepare machinery and equipment lay-out drawings for the processing of building permits and other government mandated requirements.


Qualifications:

  1. Licensed Mechanical Engineer.
  2. Proficient in AutoCAD and Microsoft Office Applications.
  3. Preferably with experience in generation of cost estimate.
  4. Preferably with experience on basic mechanical engineering design.


Qualified candidates must be willing to work on-site at Bugo, Cagayan de Oro. Working Schedule: Mon-Sat.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
An exciting opportunity is waiting for you in AP Renewables Inc., (An AboitizPower Business Unit). We are currently looking for A-Talents to join our team as Mechanical Engineer. The position shall be responsible for the Mechanical planning, review, and the implementation of the plant's maintenance and asset management plans and procedures relating to the plant Mechanical Systems. This position will support or lead project implementation of the life cycle of plant systems relating to Mechanical Systems. Moreover, the position will also assist the Reliability Supervisor in the implementation and continuous improvement of the different Reliability Team objectives and Reliability Engineering Department activities.


Roles and Responsibilities:


  • Establishes and leads the implementation, reviews and improves asset management system such as Reliability Centered Maintenance (Failure Mode Analysis), Asset Condition Assessment (ACA), Failure Mode, Effects, Critical Assessment (FMECA), and Root Cause Analysis (RCA) in alignment with the Asset management policies and procedures.
  • Review, Recommend and Supports the APRI Policies, Procedures, and Guidelines relating to the Plant Mechanical and Piping Systems. This position will lead the governance for the APRI implementation of necessary document compliance or localization.
  • Leads Root-Cause Analysis (RCA) process for all Technical incidents and monitors all recommended corrective action items as delegated by the supervisor.
  • Plans, reviews, asses and implements Engineering projects. These includes consideration of the asset life cycle, system process improvements, strategic planning and collaboration with other departments.
  • Reviews and provides technical expertise and assists in the implementation of Management and Change (MOC) initiation review, specifically for Mechanical related, and ensures any change was recorded and managed accordingly.
  • Identifies the risks in terms of reliability engineering and suggests solutions to the direct team leader (identify equipment failures and risk treatment plans).


Requirements:

At least 2 years relevant experience in the Power Generation Industry

Graduate of B.S. Mechanical Engineering

Registered Mechanical Engineer

title: Jr. Project Engineer
job_desc:
Job Description of a Jr Project Engineer in Construction of Sewage Treatment Plant:


1. Project Planning: Assist senior project engineers in developing project plans, schedules, and budgets. Contribute to the overall project objectives, milestones, and deliverables for mechanical construction activities.

2. Design and Engineering: Collaborate with the design team to develop mechanical engineering designs, technical specifications, and drawings for sewage treatment plant components.

3. Construction Oversight: Provide on-site support during the construction phase, monitoring progress, and ensuring adherence to engineering drawings, specifications, and safety protocols. Collaborate with contractors and subcontractors to resolve technical issues and ensure quality workmanship.

4. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of project activities, including progress reports, site instructions, and technical documentation.

5. Health and Safety: Promote a culture of safety by enforcing adherence to applicable health and safety regulations and company policies. Identify and mitigate potential hazards associated with mechanical construction activities.

6. Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate effectively with project teams, including architects, engineers, contractors, and subcontractors. Communicate project status, risks, and issues to senior project engineers and project management.

title: Manager - Cabin Interiors
job_desc:
Department

Fleet Technical Management

Employee Type

Probationary

  • Cebu Pacific ’s commitment to ensuring every Juan’s safety at all times will always be a top priority. Our Engineering & Fleet Management team leverage on their technical expertise and strong partnership with various business functions in upholding our commitment to our aircrafts’ airworthiness, safety, and reliability, of our growing fleet, aligning with the highest aviation standards. At Cebu Pacific, we do more than aircraft maintenance—we engineer innovation and design strategies that shape the future of air travel of every Juan.

Be a Moment Maker and craft solutions that uphold operational excellence and overall Cebu Pacific flying experience as a Manager, Cabin Interiors . Visit our careers site to learn more about how your moment matters at Cebu Pacific: CEB Careers Site

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Team Leadership & Development: Lead, mentor, and manage the Cabin Interior Engineering Team, ensuring high technical competency, performance, and compliance with safety regulations.
  • Cabin Maintenance & Defect Management: Oversee cabin interior maintenance activities, ensuring efficient defect management, root cause analysis, and reliability improvements.
  • Cabin Modifications & Upgrades: Manage and oversee cabin modification projects, including cabin refurbishments, layout changes, and cabin equipment installations to meet operational, regulatory, and safety requirements.
  • Regulatory Compliance & Certification: Ensure compliance with CAAP, FAA, and relevant EASA Part 21J standards, including approval of cabin interior modifications and repairs.
  • Technical Oversight: Evaluate engineering documentation, service bulletins, and airworthiness directives for incorporation into the airline's maintenance program.
  • Stakeholder & Supplier Management: Collaborate with OEMs, maintenance providers, lessors, and regulatory authorities to optimize cabin maintenance and modification strategies.
  • Cost & Project Management: Lead cabin interior projects, ensuring timely execution and cost-effectiveness, including negotiations with vendors and MRO providers.
  • Safety & Risk Management: Maintain compliance with Cebu Pacific’s Safety Management System (SMS), ensuring all cabin interior maintenance and modifications meet the highest safety and quality standards.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Aeronautical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field
  • Must have a PRC License (Aeronautical Engineer or equivalent)
  • Additional certification in cabin interiors, modification approval processes, or airworthiness regulations is an advantage.
  • Minimum ten (10) years of experience in aircraft cabin interior maintenance, modifications, or engineering roles at a major airline or MRO.
  • EASA Part 21J & Part 21G experience with a clear understanding of regulatory requirements for cabin interior modifications and repairs.

Why Join Us:

  • We are the first Great Place to Work ® certified airline in Southeast Asia.

title: Mechanical Project Engineer
job_desc:
Oversees and manages mechanical projects from start to finish. Conducts engineering review and drawings interpretation and work with regard to all mechanical and/or steel structure erection work aspects on site and report to the Site manager.


Responsibilities:

  • Reviews and approves technical designs, specifications, and calculations to ensure compliance with project requirements and industry standards.
  • Monitors project expenses, tracks costs, and makes effective budgeting decisions are important aspects of your role.

  • Serves as the main point of contact for stakeholders, such as clients, contractors, and senior management. Regularly updates them on project progress, milestones, and any issues that may arise is essential.

title: Graduate Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
A Future with purpose

At Arup we’re dedicated to sustainable development and to do socially useful work that has meaning. Our purpose, shared values and collaborative approach has set us apart for over 75 years, guiding how we shape a better world.

We solve the world's most complex problems and deliver what seems impossible. We explore challenges with curiosity and creativity - using technology, imagination and rigour to deliver remarkable outcomes.

The Opportunity

Working with the Buildings Team, the Graduate Engineer will assist structural team in the accomplishment of assigned Projects and deliver accurate and correct drawings, calculations and analysis.

As a graduate, you’ll transition from academic learning to real-world applications, working on diverse projects that challenge your problem-solving skills and creativity. This role provides a structured environment where you can develop your technical skills, gain hands-on experience, and receive mentorship from experienced engineers.

The role is based in Manila office.

Your role in our team


  • Prepares design calculations based on the specific requirements of the project assigned by Team Leader
  • Ensure timeliness and accuracy of own output by checking against required standards and agreed deadlines.
  • Coordinates work with other disciplines.
  • Fulfils other responsibilities assigned from time to time.


At Arup, you belong to an extraordinary collective – in which we support individuality to thrive. Our strength comes from how we respect, share and connect our diverse experiences, perspectives and ideas. You will have the opportunity do socially useful work that has meaning – to Arup, to your career, to our members and to the clients and communities we serve.

Is this role right for you?


  • Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering; licensed or Registered Engineer is preferred.
  • Preferred: 1-2 years of experience, but fresh graduates are encouraged to apply.
  • With programming skills and experience is a must. Programming software such as Visual Basic, C-Plus, C-sharp, MathLab, etc.
  • Able to provide and develop design calculations, develop detailed drawings and prepare specifications.
  • Be able to demonstrate strong design ability and engineering solutions on major and/or complex projects.
  • Engineering design skills and knowledge in building services system
  • Able to adapt both local and international standards (i.e. US standards, BS, JIS, etc.)
  • Excellent communications skills (both written and verbal) essential for team-based working and must be able to prepare project correspondences and reports.
  • Excellent skills with Microsoft applications (word, excel, PowerPoint)
  • Knowledge and practical experience of general analysis, design software an advantage
  • Must be motivated, proactive and willing to take on new challenges.
  • Must be able to maintain and develop successful client relationships and must be a team player and keen learner.
  • Able to work independently with minimum supervision and should be a team player and open to co-ordinating with engineers of other trades / inter-disciplinary coordination.
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines is essential
  • Must be willing to be assigned to project site and shall be readily available to conduct site inspection and survey.
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines is essential.
  • Able to understand the balance of engineering priorities on differing project


We’re looking for people who are curious and ready to evolve how you think and work. Our strength comes from how we respect, share and connect our diverse experiences, perspectives and ideas. At Arup, you belong to an extraordinary collective – in which we encourage individuality to thrive. If you can share your knowledge and ideas and encourage others to do the same; whilst having a desire to deliver excellent services for clients – we’d like to hear from you.

Not ready to apply just yet or have some questions? Contact Ivy at ivy.baguis@arup.com

What We Offer You

At Arup, we care about each member’s success, so we can grow together.

Guided by our values, we provide an attractive total reward that recognises the contribution of each of our members to our shared success. As well as competitive, fair and equitable pay, we offer a career in which all of our members can belong, grow and thrive – through benefits that support health and wellbeing, a wide range of learning opportunities and many possibilities to have an impact through the work they do.

We are owned in trust on behalf of our members, giving us the freedom, with personal responsibility, to set our own direction and choose work that aligns with our purpose and adds to Arup’s legacy. Our members collaborate on ambitious projects to deliver remarkable outcomes for our clients and communities.

Profit Share is a key part of our reward, enabling members to share in the results of our collective efforts. We also provide medical insurance, life assurance, accident insurance. In addition, we offer flexible work hours and a hybrid work arrangement.

Different People, Shared Values

Arup is an equal opportunity employer that actively promotes and nurtures a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of age (within legal limits), gender identity or expression, marital status, disability, neurotype or mental health, race or ethnicity, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you’re pregnant or on family leave. We are an open environment that embraces diverse experiences, perspectives, and ideas – this drives our excellence.

Guided by our values and alignment with the UN Sustainable Development Goals, we create and contribute to equitable spaces and systems, while cultivating a sense of belonging for all. Our internal employee networks support our inclusive culture: from race, ethnicity and cross-cultural working to gender equity and LGBTQ+ and disability inclusion – we aim to create a space for you to express yourself and make a positive difference. Discover more about life at Arup at www.arup.com/careers/your-life-at-arup.

We are committed to making our recruitment process and workplaces accessible to all candidates. Please contact Ivy Baguis at ivy.baguis@arup.com to let us know if you need any assistance or reasonable adjustments throughout your application or interview process, and/or to perform the essential functions of the role. We will do everything we can to support you.

Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the employer’s personal data policies, a copy of which is available on Arup’s Legal page.

title: Focused Improvement Engineer
job_desc:
About Unilever

Unilever is the place where you can bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. You will work on brands that are loved and improve the lives f our consumers and the communities around us. You will lead innovations, big and small, that will make our business win and grow. You will learn from brilliant business leaders and colleagues

who provide mentorship and inspiration so that you can become a better you.

Job Summary

  • Responsible for driving Kaizen implementation across the site improving key factory metrics on: Safety, Quality, Output Reliability and OEE
  • Supports in development of Autonomous Maintenance Kaizens, CILT Calendar drafting and execution. In the past year, FI Engineers were instrumental in increasing site OEE from 67% to 72%.
  • Supports day-to-day Factory Operations in investigation of Emergency Work Orders, Q-Emergency Work Orders and S-Emergency Work Orders.
  • Conducts Non-Value Adding Activity analysis to help reduce NVAA across site
  • Leads Time-Studies required for Kaizen implementation.
  • Operates new Digital Tools on-site for FI implementation: 3D Printer, Digital Scopes, High-Speed Cameras, Vibration Meters.
  • Supports Waste Stream mapping and implements FI projects for Waste reduction.

Requirements

  • Graduate of Chemical. Mechanical, Manufacturing or Industrial Engineering
  • At least 1-year relevant experience in the same function and industry
  • Good technical understanding and analysis skills
  • Good knowledge of manufacturing process
  • Influencing skills
  • Experience in Supply Chain operations
  • Manufacturing and/or Engineering experience
  • Proven track record of analytical thinking and project management
  • Must be willing to work and be assigned in Gen Trias, Cavite

We highly encourage applicants to exclude information on age, gender, and school/s in view of Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion. Unilever assesses candidates based on skills, performance, experience, and leadership.

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
The Team

Our Building Services team’s mission is to play a key role in making buildings more energy efficient, sustainable, cost effective and safe to build and operate. We pride ourselves on our exemplary track record of designing innovative and sustainable mechanical and electrical solutions, that minimise the use of natural resources.

Our global Building Services team are a source of world leading expertise – and offer a pro-active and collaborative approach to skill development, and professional excellence.

Our Philippines operations represents Cundall as our Regional Centre of excellence for Data Centre design, Sustainability, and Building Services.

The Role

This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated and aspiring Mechanical Building Services engineer to join our pioneer team based in our Philippines, Makati office, to work on some of the most exciting building projects within Cundall in the region.

Working across a variety of sectors such as Education, Commercial, Retail and Critical Systems, you will work closely with colleagues of various disciplines to manage the delivery of technically-excellent, profitable projects. You will have the opportunity over time to assume greater levels of responsibility and autonomy as your professional skills develop and will be supported towards obtaining Chartership.

The Skills

Educated to degree level in Mechanical Engineering or Building Services Engineering (MEng or BEng or equivalent) and having gained broad experience in a Mechanical Engineering role within a building services context (ventilation, cooling and air conditioning, heating systems etc), you have proven your technical expertise in relevant design software including Revit, IES, CYMAP and/or Hevacomp, and have a portfolio of experience demonstrating your quality and client focussed approach.Data Center and Critical Systems experience will be highly regarded.

In your most recent position, you have consistently demontrated your ability to work on multiple projects with the assistance of Senior engineers to deliver to, and exceed linet expectations, and crucially - you have a passion for creative and intuitive design.

Given the collaborative and client focused nature of this role, excellent communication and project management skills are essential.

Job Description

 We know that to be the best at what we do we need a diverse workforce underpinned by an inclusive culture. Creating environments where everyone can find joy doing their best work is also great for everyone. That’s why we positively welcome applications from people of all backgrounds and identities, and encourage, support, and celebrate the diverse voices of our people.

title: Hydraulic Engineer
job_desc:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform repair, replacement, and maintenance of hydraulic cylinders.
  • Conduct calibration and verification tests on electronic relief valves and directional valves to ensure functionality and compliance.
  • Handle nitrogen charging and verification of accumulator airbag bladders to maintain system pressure.
  • Inspect, repair, and maintain hydraulic hoses, fitting connectors, and oil pipelines to prevent leaks and ensure operational efficiency.
  • Provide assistance in the general upkeep of hydraulic equipment and other mechanical components.
  • Participate in preventive maintenance programs to avoid downtime.
  • Maintain accurate records of equipment maintenance and repairs, following ISO documentation protocols.


Qualifications:

  • Graduate of a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or related field.
  • With 3 to 4 years of experience in the manufacturing industry, operations, or a similar role, with expertise in hydraulic systems.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_desc:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Ensures all store facilities and equipments of the building are in good working conditions at all times.
  • Implements standard maintenance program, with the emphasis on planning/schedule and preventive/predictive maintenance.
  • Communicates with supervisory personnel to discuss and resolve matters related to maintenance & safety
  • Performs other functions as may be assigned by immediate superior from time to time.


QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Licensed Mechanical Engineer
  • With at least 2 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position
  • With vacancy in Las Pinas City

title: Production Engineer (Ink Cartridge) - Santo Tomas Batangas
job_desc:
• Graduate of Bachelor's Degree in Industrial / Electronics / Mechanical Engineering
  • With at least one (1) year experience as Production Engineer
  • Knowledgeable in QC Tools
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications

title: Mall Engineer - The Mall | Nustar
job_desc:
Department

NUSTAR-Engineering

Employee Type

Probationary

The Mall Engineer ensures that the mall equipment and facilities (e.g. AC equipment, electrical facilities, water facilities, sewage treatment plant, ventilating equipment, kitchen exhaust equipment, generators) are in good operating condition and operate at maximum efficiency.

Qualifications

  • Must be a licensed Electrical or Mechanical Engineer. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.
  • Candidates who have at least three (3) years of work experience in building/facilities management and operations will have advantage.
  • Candidate must be residing or willing to be assigned in Cebu.
  • We want smart, honest, and energetic people who love what we do.

Experience Range Range (Years)

1 - 3 years

2024-05-15
